content.question: A horizontal disk of radius <math alttext="0.2 meter" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.30em"></mspace><mtext>m</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and mass <math alttext="0.3 kilogram" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.3</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.30em"></mspace><mtext>kg</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is mounted on a central vertical axle so that a student can study the relationship between net torque and change in angular momentum of the disk. In the experiment, the student uses a force probe to collect data pertaining to the net torque exerted on the edge of the disk as a function of time, as shown in the graph. The disk is initially at rest. At what instant in time does the disk have the greatest angular momentum?

unit.text: 6: Energy and Momentum of Rotating Systems

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
